main_train_station.name: Delft Station
connections: National rail services (NS) to major Dutch cities (Amsterdam, Rotterdam, The Hague, Utrecht)
International connections via Rotterdam Centraal or Schiphol Airport

local_transport.details: Line 1 runs through Delft, connecting the station, city center, TU Delft, and continues to The Hague Center, HS Station, and Scheveningen Beach.
Extensive network serving the city, TU Delft campus, and surrounding areas.

local_transport.provider: Various rental shops (near station, city center)
local_transport.details: Highly recommended way to explore Delft and surroundings. Excellent cycling infrastructure. OV-fiets rental available at the station.
local_transport.payment: Rental fees (daily/hourly). OV-fiets requires personal OV-chipkaart.

local_transport.details: The historic city center is compact and best explored on foot. Be mindful of cyclists and uneven cobblestones.

nearby_airports.name: Rotterdam The Hague Airport (RTM)
nearby_airports.connection: Bus (e.g., RET Airport Bus 33 to Meijersplein, then Metro E to Delft) or Taxi/Uber.

nearby_airports.name: Amsterdam Airport Schiphol (AMS)
nearby_airports.connection: Direct train from Schiphol Plaza to Delft Station.

car_travel.parking: Limited and expensive within the historic center. Use designated parking garages (e.g., Marktgarage, Zuidpoortgarage, Prinsenhofgarage) or Park & Ride facilities outside the center.
car_travel.accessibility: Many central streets are pedestrianized or have restricted vehicle access.

safety_and_health.general_safety: Delft is considered a very safe city. Exercise standard precautions against pickpocketing in crowded tourist areas (Markt, station) and lock your bike securely.

pharmacies.availability: Widely available ('Apotheek'). Check for nearest duty pharmacy ('dienstapotheek') outside regular hours.
pharmacies.notes: Standard prescription and over-the-counter medications available.

hospitals.name: Reinier de Graaf Gasthuis
hospitals.notes: Main hospital serving Delft and surroundings, includes emergency department ('Spoedeisende Hulp').

safety_and_health.tap_water: Safe to drink and of high quality.

money_and_communication.atms: Widely available ('geldautomaat'), especially near banks, shopping areas, and the station. Look for Geldmaat machines.
money_and_communication.credit_cards: Visa and Mastercard widely accepted in shops, restaurants, and hotels. American Express less common. Contactless payments are prevalent.

tipping.restaurants_cafes: Service charge is included by law. Tipping is not obligatory but appreciated for good service (rounding up the bill or leaving 5-10%).
tipping.taxis: Rounding up the fare is common.

language.english_proficiency: Very high, especially in tourist areas, shops, restaurants, and among younger people.

basic_phrases.Dutch: Dank u wel / Dank je wel

connectivity.wifi: Widely available in cafes, hotels, libraries, and some public areas. Eduroam available on TU Delft campus.
connectivity.mobile_data: Excellent 4G/5G coverage. Consider a local SIM card (available at supermarkets/phone shops) or an eSIM for longer stays.

money_and_communication.postal_services: PostNL service points available in many supermarkets and shops for sending mail and parcels.

tourist_information.name: VVV Delft (Tourist Information)
tourist_information.services: Maps, brochures, guided tour bookings, hotel information, souvenirs.

opening_hours.shops: Generally Mon 11:00-18:00, Tue-Fri 09:30/10:00-18:00, Sat 09:30/10:00-17:00. Supermarkets often open longer hours and on Sundays. Some city center shops open Sundays 12:00-17:00.
opening_hours.museums: Typically Tue-Sun 10:00/11:00 - 17:00. Often closed on Mondays (except major holidays). Check individual museum websites.
